abstract: Selective public universities are increasingly interested in enrolling out-of-state students, The Chronicle of Higher Education is reporting.
snippet: Selective public universities are increasingly interested in enrolling out-of-state students, The Chronicle of Higher Education is reporting.
lead_paragraph: In an article published on Sunday in The Chronicle of Higher Education, Eric Hoover and Josh Keller reported that public universities are escalating their recruitment of out-of-state students - students who not only bring geographic diversity to campus, but also pay higher tuition rates and improve a school's bottom line. That finding echoes the results of a recent Inside Higher Ed survey that concluded that more universities are seeking students based on their ability to pay.
